basics.name: Ke Ding
basics.label: Graduate Research Assistant
basics.summary: An ambitious individual with expertise in Biomechanics and Ergonomics, boasting a distinguished academic journey from The Ohio State University culminating in a Ph.D. in Integrated Systems Engineering

work.name: The Ohio State University
work.summary: Investigated the use of motion characteristics to differentiate between individuals who are performing a sincere effort from those who are exaggerating their condition or pain.

volunteer.organization: 38th Annual Edward F. Hays Advanced Research Forum
volunteer.summary: Organized and led the postdoc group sessions for the Arts/Humanities/Social Science category at the 36th Edward F. Hays Graduate Research Forum.
highlights: Ensured smooth and efficient operation of the session, including managing time constraints and resolving any logistical issues.

education.institution: The Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio
courses: Risk Assessment Tools for Occupational Musculoskeletal Disorders
Ergonomics in the Product Design Process
Principles of Occupational Biomechanics and Ergonomics

awards.title: Dean's List Recognition
awards.summary: Recognition for academic excellence as a Dean's List awardee for three consecutive years at The Ohio State University.

certificates.name: Will be published soon, so stay tuned

publications.name: Modeling the Effects of Hydration on Viscoelastic Properties of Nucleus Pulposus Tissue in Shear and Compression using the Fractional Zener Model.
publications.publisher: 2023 ORS Annual Meeting, and ORS PSRS 5th International Spine Research Symposium.
publications.summary: Explored DNA origami sensor function to see if it is affected by hydrostatic pressure; analyzed the capability of DNA origami sensors to discern spatial changes in ion concentration inside a microfluidic device- generated ion gradient.

publications.name: Will be published soon, so stay tuned

skills.name: Engineering
keywords: CATIA and LS-DYNA, Certified SOLIDWORKS Professional (CSWP)

references.reference: Assistant Director - SRI, Biodynamics Laboratory Research Coordinator - Integrated Systems Engineering

projects.name: Efficacy Assessment of Endoscopic Procedure Engineering Control
projects.summary: Mitigate work-related musculoskeletal disorders (WRMSD) in gastroenterologists by evaluating the effectiveness of a novel intervention - a strap designed to support the left hand during endoscopic procedures.
